revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of August 29, 1886, at the Island of Carriacou
tldr: The astronomers appointed by the Royal Society observed the total solar eclipse of August 29, 1886, at the Island of Carriacou. They used various instruments and methods to study the solar spectrum, corona, and the effects of the eclipse on the surrounding environment. Their findings provided valuable insights into the behavior of the Sun and the potential impacts of future solar events.
